title: Yellowstone writer Taylor Sheridan is now  shooting over $US1b worth  of television shows , despite his stubborn , uncompromising attitude
body_text:
You’re not ready for this.” It was early 2017, and Taylor Sheridan stood before Viacom executives describing Yellowstone, the television series he had conceived with producer John Linson. Sheridan had sold it to HBO some years before, only to see it languish, as so many projects do. But now it was close to finally being seen by the world, thanks to its saviour and champion – a former child actor named David Glasser, who was then an executive with the Weinstein Company.
Atlantic
